title: Inertia of certain links is very large

content.raw:
Several links are defined in the drc_robot model with the following inertia and mass properties


```
mass = 0.1 kg
ixx = 0.01 kg m^2
iyy = 0.01 kg m^2
izz = 0.01 kg m^2
```

Assuming that the link is a ellipsoid of uniform density, the length of the semi-principle axes can be calculated using (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ellipsoid#Dynamical_properties). This elipsoid will reduce to a sphere with a radius of 0.5m, which is way larger than the link itself.

I've attached a plot of the inertia ellipsoid of the individual links offset from the robot model. The links that have non-realistic inertia data are
```
mtorso (mass = 0.55, ixx=iyy=izz=0.1, radius=0.6742m)
[l,r]_palm (mass = 0.1, ixx=iyy=izz=0.01, radius = 0.5m)
[l,r]_f[0,1,2]_0 (mass = 0.1, ixx=iyy=izz=0.01, radius = 0.5m)
[l,r]_f[0,1,2]_1 (mass = 0.1, ixx=iyy=izz=0.01, radius = 0.5m)
[l,r]_f[0,1,2]_2 (mass = 0.1, ixx=iyy=izz=0.01, radius = 0.5m)
[l,r]_uglut (mass = 0.5166, ixx=iyy=izz=0.01, radius = 0.31m)
[l,r]_uglut (mass = 0.69, ixx=iyy=izz=0.01, radius = 0.2692)
[l_r]_talus (mass = 0.1, ixx=iyy=izz=0.01, radius = 0.5m)
```

So, it seems to be the hands and some connecting links in the torso an the talus. 

(in the urdf, a seperate (l,r)_f(0,1,2)_(0,1,2)_accel link is defined for the fingers. The mass and inertia of this link is added to the finger link when you use gazebo to export to SDF).

In our previous simulations, we estimated the inertia of some links by assuming it is an ellipsoid of uniform density that is about the same size as the real link.
content.html:
Several links are defined in the drc_robot model with the following inertia and mass properties

mass = 0.1 kg
ixx = 0.01 kg m^2
iyy = 0.01 kg m^2
izz = 0.01 kg m^2

Assuming that the link is a ellipsoid of uniform density, the length of the semi-principle axes can be calculated using (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ellipsoid#Dynamical_properties). This elipsoid will reduce to a sphere with a radius of 0.5m, which is way larger than the link itself.

I've attached a plot of the inertia ellipsoid of the individual links offset from the robot model. The links that have non-realistic inertia data are

mtorso (mass = 0.55, ixx=iyy=izz=0.1, radius=0.6742m)
[l,r]_palm (mass = 0.1, ixx=iyy=izz=0.01, radius = 0.5m)
[l,r]_f[0,1,2]_0 (mass = 0.1, ixx=iyy=izz=0.01, radius = 0.5m)
[l,r]_f[0,1,2]_1 (mass = 0.1, ixx=iyy=izz=0.01, radius = 0.5m)
[l,r]_f[0,1,2]_2 (mass = 0.1, ixx=iyy=izz=0.01, radius = 0.5m)
[l,r]_uglut (mass = 0.5166, ixx=iyy=izz=0.01, radius = 0.31m)
[l,r]_uglut (mass = 0.69, ixx=iyy=izz=0.01, radius = 0.2692)
[l_r]_talus (mass = 0.1, ixx=iyy=izz=0.01, radius = 0.5m)

So, it seems to be the hands and some connecting links in the torso an the talus.

(in the urdf, a seperate (l,r)f(0,1,2)(0,1,2)_accel link is defined for the fingers. The mass and inertia of this link is added to the finger link when you use gazebo to export to SDF).

In our previous simulations, we estimated the inertia of some links by assuming it is an ellipsoid of uniform density that is about the same size as the real link.
